description:
This course is designed to introduce the undergraduate student to the structure of tissues at the cellular level and to the way in which those tissues are assembled into organs. This knowledge of structure will be the basis for discussion of tissue and organ function. 

Lab fee $150.
name: HISTOLOGY

values.comments:
This course is designed to introduce the undergraduate student to the structure of tissues at the cellular level and to the way in which those tissues are assembled into organs. This knowledge of structure will be the basis for discussion of tissue and organ function.

Students found the class “very valuable.” It was “in-depth and interesting,” and “a great preparatory class for medical school hopefuls.” The TAs were also widely praised. 

Dr. Weil “has a passion for the class and it shines through in her lectures.” Another student wrote that Dr. Weil was “always available before class” and was “very helpful and engaged,” with a “great sense of humor.” 

This was “a challenging course that really requires a lot of work and attention to detail.” Pre-requisites for this class include BIOL 101 and 102, or BIOL 121 and 202. There is also a $150 lab fee.
Note: Fewer than eight students reviewed this course.
